title: MBTA Hingham ferry service canceled for Feb. 13 due to ice in the harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA cancels all Hingham/Hull ferry services on Feb. 13 due to thick ice in Boston Harbor.
Shuttle buses are replacing ferry service, running from Nantasket Beach to Pemberton Point until 10:35 p.m.
Boston's recent snowstorm, bringing over a foot of snow, caused multiple ferry cancellations due to harbor ice.

title: Retired Gloucester firefighter dies days after being struck by Lowell police cruiser
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Daniel Kennedy, a retired Gloucester firefighter, died after being hit by a Lowell police cruiser at UMass Lowell.
Kennedy was struck on Wilder Street outside the McGauvran Center and later died at Lahey Hospital.
An investigation by the Middlesex DA and Massachusetts State Police is ongoing to determine the incident's cause.

title: 5 players on Red Sox’ roster bubble entering spring training
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Triston Casas is unlikely to start the season with the Red Sox due to ongoing health issues and roster depth.
Prospect Kristian Campbell may begin 2026 in Triple-A due to past performance issues and competition for the DH spot.
Pitchers Payton Tolle and Connelly Early are expected to start in Triple-A despite strong potential, due to a crowded rotation.

title: Plans confirmed for new ICE facility in N.H.; documents reveal state officials knew for weeks
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: New ICE facility confirmed for Merrimack, NH; state officials knew about it weeks before public disclosure.
ACLU-NH released state documents detailing plans for an ICE detention center at 50 Robert Milligan Parkway.
Gov. Kelly Ayotte under scrutiny for alleged lack of transparency; DNCR Commissioner Sarah Stewart resigns.

title: Ex-Patriots coach Dante Scarnecchia isn’t panicking over Will Campbell’s play
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' Will Campbell will remain at left tackle despite struggling at the end of the 2025 season.
Coach Mike Vrabel confirmed Campbell won't be moved to another position in the upcoming 2026 season.
Former All-Pro Terron Armstead offered to help Campbell improve his play during the offseason workouts in Dallas.

title: Video: Mike Vrabel shares message to distraught Patriots after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel addressed his distraught players after the Patriots' 29-13 Super Bowl LX loss to the Seattle Seahawks.
Vrabel focused on unity and future growth, emphasizing the team's long-term potential and building upon the 2025 season.
Despite losing the Super Bowl, the Patriots improved significantly under Vrabel, winning 14 games after a four-win season in 2024.

title: Patriots reportedly make changes to coaching staff, move Williams to ‘high-ranking’ role
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots move defensive coordinator Terrell Williams to a high-ranking role on Mike Vrabel's coaching staff after his recovery from cancer.
Zak Kuhr, interim defensive play-caller, is the favored candidate to become the Patriots' new defensive coordinator.
Patriots' defense, under Kuhr, ranked fourth in NFL points allowed, contributing significantly to their run to Super Bowl LX.

title: Pittsfield man, 69, killed in hit-and-run crash that dragged him ‘lengthy distance,’ DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: William Colbert, 69, was killed in a hit-and-run incident in Pittsfield on Tuesday night and dragged a lengthy distance.
The incident occurred around 11:33 p.m. when Colbert was hit by a dark-colored sedan near Linden Street and Francis Avenue.
Police are seeking the driver who fled the scene and are asking for any information or surveillance video from the public.

title: ‘This is only the beginning’: Ann Michael Maye shares encouraging message after Patriots Super Bowl loss
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots lost Super Bowl LX 29-13 to the Seahawks after being shut out for the first three quarters.
Quarterback Drake Maye set a Super Bowl record with 235 passing yards in a single quarter despite injury.
Ann Michael Maye expressed gratitude for the season on Instagram, saying it's just the beginning for the team.

title: This dad is running Boston to give back to Boston Children’s Hospital
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Nick Gallagher, 38, from Plymouth, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon for Boston Children's Hospital's Miles for Miracles team.
Gallagher's son, who has received neurology care since birth, serves as his inspiration and patient partner during the marathon.
Proceeds from his marathon run aim to support life-changing services for children and families at Boston Children's Hospital.
